poem:
Title: "Truss Unravelled"

In the eye of political storm, she reeled,
49 days of fleeting glory,
Two monarchs looked on, as history sealed,
The shortest term, an end so sorry.
Veiled beneath the cloud of failure, they say,
She haunts the halls, spectre of yesterday.
An aura of nine, grim and bleaker,
Still she remains, perhaps, the bravest risk-taker.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘She still carries an aura of spectacular failure’: why hasn’t Liz Truss gone away? The brief and calamitous premiership of Liz Truss broke all sorts of political records. It was the shortest by far in British history – just 49 days, though oddly in those seven weeks she became the first prime minister since Churchill to serve under two monarchs. Her approval rating before she resigned – 9% – was the worst yet recorded by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
